content: Rawan Alghofaili Rawan Alghofaili Office: ECSS 4.704 · University of Texas at Dallas · rawan(at)utdallas(dot)edu Link to my Google Scholar Link to my ResearchGate Link to my LinkedIn Link to my Github I graduated in August 2022 with a PhD from the Department of Computer Science at George Mason University where I received the Distinguished Academic Achievement Award. During my PhD, I worked under the mentorship of Professor Lap-Fai (Craig) Yu, exploring the design of context-aware AR/VR/MR system interactions. In the Summer of 2020, I interned at Adobe’s Creative Intelligence Lab under the mentorship of Cuong Nguyen, Vojtěch Krs, Nathan Carr and Radomír Měch. I was also a research intern in the Summer and Fall of 2021 at Meta Reality Labs working under the mentorship of Ben Lafreniere. Prior to venturing into the world of PhD life, I received an MEng. (Master's of Engineering) in Computer Science from Cornell University and an MS (Master's of Science) from the University of Massachusetts-Boston. Research interests: Computational Design, Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality, Mixed Reality, Graphics, Vision, Machine Learning and HCI. I joined CS@UT Dallas as a tenure-track Assistant Professor in Fall 2023! I'm looking for well-motivated students who are excited about research in AR/VR/MR and HCI. If you're interested, please e-mail me your C.V. and transcripts.
